intro: Weinmannia guanacasana, commonly known as the Guanacasana tree, is a species native to the Andean region of South America. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its compound leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers. Its botanical features include small, fragrant white flowers and woody fruits that contain seeds. The species is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
